titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Pennsylvania Association for Retarded Children, Allegheny County Chapter Records, 1952-1965 AIS.1966.01

did.unittitle: Pennsylvania Association for Retarded Children, Allegheny County Chapter Records

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Pennsylvania Association for Retarded Children. Allegheny County Chapter

did.abstract: This collection contains the records of the Pennsylvania Association for Retarded Children, Allegheny County Chapter. This chapter's purpose was to tend to the general welfare of mentally retarded children in Pittsburgh and Allegheny County. The association had interest in school policies as well as home care and further education of the mentally retarded, sponsoring socialization classes to help prepare children for the world. The chapter changed its name to Arc of Allegheny in the 1980s. This collection contains administrative information, journals, meeting minutes, correspondence, articles, committee data, as well as information on social events.

bioghist.head: History
bioghist.p: The Allegheny County Chapter of the Pennsylvania Association for Retarded Children (PARC) was a voluntary, non-profit organization formed in 1950. The chapter was founded by a group of families with children affected by mental retardation. The group was originally named Friends of the Mentally Retarded. It wasn't until 1956 that Friends of the Mentally Retarded became a local chapter of PARC, renaming itself the Allegheny County Chapter of the Pennsylvania Association for Retarded Children.

The goal of the chapter was to promote the general welfare of mentally retarded children of all ages in western Pennsylvania, regardless of race, color or creed. This was done in communities, institutions both public and private, and religious schools. PARC also sought to further the advancement of research and therapy in the field of mental retardation. The chapter was responsible for creating a better understanding of the problems associated with mentally retarded children by reaching out to the public.

The chapter elected its first officers in May, 1951 although it actually began with temporary officers in the fall of 1950. By the mid 1950s, the chapter had developed services such as sheltered workshops, camping opportunities and day classes established in the Pittsburgh Board of Education, the Allegheny County School System, and the Catholic Diocesan Schools. These classes gave children the opportunity for further education in a safe environment. Swimming classes and summer camp activities were created for families and their children at the Brashear Association Camp and the David B. Oliver Pool. PARC also initiated the first teacher-training program in Pennsylvania for the education of mentally retarded children. PARC changed its name to Association of Retarded Children (ARC) of Allegheny County in the 1980s. This organization is still in operation to date.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection reflects the activities of the Pennsylvania Association for Retarded Children, Allegheny Chapter from 1952-1963. It includes administrative records, correspondence, meeting minutes, information on social events, articles, fundraising information, and data on PARC and National Association for Retarded Children (NARC).

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p:
The collection has been divided into the following series:
Series I. Administrative Records, 1952-1964
Series II. Correspondence, 1953-1963
Series III. Subject and Program Files, 1953-1963
Series IV. Committees, 1953-1963
Series V. Employment and Membership, 1959-1963
Series VI. Publicity, 1956-1963
Series VII. Social Events, 1958-1963
Series VIII. Conventions, 1956-1960
Series IX. Fundraising, 1953-1961
Series X. Programs, 1953-1963
Series XI. Scholarships and Awards, 1955-1956
Series XII. Articles, 1954-1964
Series XIII. Miscellaneous Material, 1958-1960 and undated
Series XIV. PARC/NARC, 1952-1963 Additional scope and content notes are found at each series level.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: These records were a gift of the Pennsylvania Association for Retarded Children, January 10, 1966.

odd.head: Previous Citation
odd.p: Pennsylvania Association for Retarded Children, Allegheny County Chapter Records, AIS.1966.01, Archives Service Center, University of Pittsburgh

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Pennsylvania Association for Retarded Children, Allegheny County Chapter Records, AIS.1966.01, Archives & Special Collections, University of Pittsburgh Library System

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was processed by ASC Staff in 1987 and then further processed and arranged by Jamie Hamel December 2004.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: Permission for publication is given on behalf of the University of Pittsburgh as the owner of the physical items and is not intended to include or imply permission of the copyright holder, which must also be obtained.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series contains administrative records, the constitution and by-laws as well as information on the president and treasurer, budget data, correspondence, payroll registers, journals and meeting minutes.

did.unittitle: First Draft of a Revised Constitution, Unofficial and Unedited
Report of Income and Disbursements, Treasurer

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series contains correspondence to and from PARC from 1953-1963. It has been arranged alphabetically and chronologically.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series contains information on various organizations, events, and individuals related to PARC. The folders are arranged alphabetically.

did.unittitle: Fact Sheet - Speaker's Bureau Return Cards
Legislative Material: Governor's Budget, for Public Welfare and Correction
Memo: East Pittsburgh Opportunity Center for Mentally Retarded Adults, July
National Foundation for Neuromuscular Disease, Inc.
President's Panel on Mental Retardation, April
Transportation for Handicap (School laws of Pennsylvania Section 1374)
"Using Community Resources to Help the Homebound or Very Retarded Child"
Why ACC-PARC in no longer a participant in United Fund

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series contains the records of PARC committees, which is mainly in the form of minutes and correspondence. The committees were created to administer the various facets of PARC such as: education, fundraising, membership, social events, and recreation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series contains employment and membership records for the Allegheny County Chapter of PARC.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The records in this series relate to PARC's publicity campaign, which was carried out with news briefs, releases, publications, and public relations information.

did.unittitle: Pennsylvania Association for Retarded Children Briefs
Publicity and Public Relations, News Releases
Publicity and Public Relations, Speakers Bureau
Speakers Bureau Letters and Request Cards

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The information in this series consists of social events hosted by PARC. These events were usually hosted as family outings.

did.unittitle: Summer Festival - Crafton - Ingram Shopping Center

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The folders in this series consist of information about annual conventions hosted by PARC.

did.unittitle: 7th Annual Convention, Penn Sheraton Hotel, Pgh., May 24-25

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series includes data on the fundraising carried out by the Allegheny County Chapter of PARC.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This section holds information on programs sponsored by PARC, Allegheny Chapter. The Health and Welfare Association worked in connection with the chapter on studies concerning physical rehabilitation of the mentally retarded. Friends of the Mentally Retarded was the name of PARC when it was first started. These folders hold information on the early stages of the organization.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series has information on scholarships and awards granted by PARC.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series consists of articles pertaining to mentally retarded children. The files are arranged alphabetically. The miscellaneous folders contain reports, employment and volunteer information, convention notes, financial reports, membership lists, meeting minutes and correspondence.

scopecontent.p: This series contains miscellaneous information about the Chapter.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
